metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Part II - Draw a Clock Face
The clock needs a clock face. Create a JavaScript function to draw a clock face:
content.html: The clock needs a clock face. Create a JavaScript function to draw a clock face:

content.code_html:
function drawClock() {
  drawFace(ctx, radius);
}

function drawFace(ctx, radius) {
  const grad = ctx.createRadialGradient(0, 0 ,radius * 0.95, 0, 0, radius * 1.05);
  grad.addColorStop(0, '#333');
  grad.addColorStop(0.5, 'white');
  grad.addColorStop(1, '#333');

  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(0, 0, radius, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
  ctx.fillStyle = 'white';
  ctx.fill();

  ctx.strokeStyle = grad;
  ctx.lineWidth = radius*0.1;
  ctx.stroke();

  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.arc(0, 0, radius * 0.1, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
  ctx.fillStyle = '#333';
  ctx.fill();
}

content.text: Create a drawFace() function for drawing the clock face:
content.html: Create a drawFace() function for drawing the clock face:

content.code_html:
function drawClock() {
  drawFace(ctx, radius);
}

function drawFace(ctx, radius) {
}

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(0, 0, radius, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = 'white';
ctx.fill();

content.text: Create a radial gradient (95% and 105% of original clock radius):
content.html: Create a radial gradient (95% and 105% of original clock radius):

content.code_html: grad = ctx.createRadialGradient(0, 0, radius * 0.95, 0, 0, radius * 1.05);

content.text: Create 3 color stops, corresponding with the inner, middle, and outer edge of the arc:
content.html: Create 3 color stops, corresponding with the inner, middle, and outer edge of the arc:

content.code_html:
grad.addColorStop(0, '#333');
grad.addColorStop(0.5, 'white');
grad.addColorStop(1, '#333');

content.text: The color stops create a 3D effect.
Define the gradient as the stroke style of the drawing object:
content.html: Define the gradient as the stroke style of the drawing object:

content.code_html: ctx.strokeStyle = grad;

content.text: Define the line width of the drawing object (10% of radius):
content.html: Define the line width of the drawing object (10% of radius):

content.code_html: ctx.lineWidth = radius * 0.1;
ctx.stroke();

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.arc(0, 0, radius * 0.1, 0, 2 * Math.PI);
ctx.fillStyle = '#333';
ctx.fill();
